intro: Iresine flavescens, commonly known as the red leaf iron plant, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its strikingly colorful leaves, which can range from deep red to bright pink and purple hues. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white in color. It thrives in warm, humid environments and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its vibrant foliage. Iresine flavescens is a member of the Amaranthaceae family, which includes other plants with showy leaves and flowers.
